alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 7:11PM MST until July 30 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 1015 PM MST. * At 710 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tonto Village, Kohls Ranch, Hunter Creek, Mead Ranch, Christopher Creek, Bear Flat, Ponderosa Campground, Christopher Creek Campground, Upper Tonto Creek Campground and Sharp Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 260 and 276. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
